meanings.definition: The quality or state of being infusible.
meanings.sent1: The infusibleness of the metal made it perfect for use in high-temperature applications.
meanings.sent2: The infusibleness of the substance meant it could withstand extreme heat without changing form.
meanings.sent3: Despite the chef's best efforts, the infusibleness of the chocolate caused it to remain solid in the hot oven.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the infusibleness of a diamond, unyielding to any external pressure.
meanings.sent5: The infusibleness of the material was a remarkable trait that set it apart from others.

meanings.definition: The inability to be melted or fused by heat.
meanings.sent1: The infusibleness of the metal made it a preferred choice for constructing furnaces.
meanings.sent2: The infusibleness of the rock formation puzzled geologists studying its composition.
meanings.sent3: The infusibleness of the ice cream under the sun led to some comical attempts to eat it.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness was like the infusibleness of a glacier, unmoving and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: The infusibleness of the glass sculpture captured the admiration of all who saw it.
